roleset.name: to transfer gene from source organism into target organism

example.text: Expression of recombinat proteins Full-lenght and C-terminal SBP2 constructs in pASK-IB7, as our study suggested, are transformed into Escherichia coli BL21 (Promega)
example.arg: Expression of recombinat proteins Full-lenght and C-terminal SBP2 constructs in pASK-IB7

example.text: Expression plasmids of the combinations indicated (central panel) are observed to be efficiently transformed into yeast and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
example.arg: Expression plasmids of the combinations indicated (central panel)

example.text: Expression plasmids of the combinations indicated (central panel), however, are transformed into yeast and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
example.arg: Expression plasmids of the combinations indicated (central panel)

example.text: The DNA of budded viruses (BVs) can be used to transform E.coli.
The DNA of budded viruses (BVs) is observed to be used to transform E.coli.
The DNA of budded viruses, as we mentioned earlier, is likely to be used to completely transform E.coli.
To generate GST fusion proteins, the relevant DNA fragments are cloned into pGex2T(Pharmacia) and transformed into the bacterial strains BL21 or TOPP (Stratagene).
example.arg: the bacterial strains BL21 or TOPP (Stratagene)

example.text: The DNA of budded viruses (BVs) was used to transform E.coli.

example.text: The DNA of budded viruses have the ability to be efficiently transformed into E.coli and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
This construct (BVs) is likely to be used to transform the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech).
This construct are able to be transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech) and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
This construct were transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech)
This construct, as we mentioned earlier, will be used to completely transform the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech).
This construct, however, can be efficiently transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech) and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
